channel.title: web on xbgbtx
channel.description: Recent content in web on xbgbtx

item.title: L Systems
item.description: An L-System is a string rewriting process that can generate many interesting fractals. L-SystemsL-Systems I have implemented a system for rendering L-Systems using the PixiJS graphics library. Try it in your browser! View the Source Code Ideas for future improvements: Implement GUI for building custom L-Systems Add stack to the draw context in order to support more types of L-System.

item.title: Cellular Automata V2
item.description: A WebGL cellular automata runtime. Cellular AutomataCellular Automata Cellular Automata Try it in your browser! View the Source Code Cellular automata are a captivating example of how complexity can emerge from simple rules. Cellular AutomataCellular Automata Version 2 Version 2 brings an improved user interface. The simulation is displayed full screen and a menu system floats on top. I added a new rule called ‘Life Like’ that allows for the conditions for life and dead in Conway’s Game of Life to be modified.

item.title: Artist Map
item.description: This interactive map shows the birth and formation location of nearly sixty thousand musicians and musical ensembles. Artist MapArtist Map Try it in your browser! View the Source Code Leaflet JS Map The map data is displayed using Leaflet JS - a flexible front end for map data. The map tiles are sourced from Open Street Map. WikiData Data is queried from WikiData a service that enables SPARQL queries on a database generated from the article text of Wikipedia articles.

item.title: Cellular Automata
item.description: A WebGL cellular automata runtime. Cellular AutomataCellular Automata Cellular Automata Try it in your browser! View the Source Code Cellular automata are a captivating example of how complexity can emerge from simple rules. Cellular AutomataCellular Automata GPU Acceleration Programming a cellular automata is fairly straightforward. The system simply needs to iterate through a grid and process the states of the cells. In order to make the simulation run in real time I decided to implement the system using WebGL fragment shaders.
